SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

iwork.eheap2
Class Field

java.lang.Object
  iwork.eheap2.Field
All Implemented Interfaces:
FieldValueTypes
public class Field
extends java.lang.Object
implements FieldValueTypes

This class represents a field in an Event. A Field is a package access only class, and should never be accessed directly by Event Heap program developers. All access to fields should be through the methods provided by the Event class. This is because the event class caches the serialized event for transmission and needs to track when the pre-serialized event data is no longer valid. If users change field values directly, the Event class won't know the values have changed, and won't invalidate the cached serialization data. Fields contain the following sub-fields:

  • Type: A string that specifies the type of this field. It can be any of the following:
    • int, long, float, double: Indicates that field is of one of these types. These are defined as objects that can be represented by the standard Java object serialization of the Integer, Long, Float and Double types, which should be fairly standard network order versions of the standard numeric types. In Java this means that they are stored in this field as the standard java.lang.* object for that numeric type.
    • string: This is a string object which can be represented with the standard UTF-8 representation used for serialization of strings by Java. It is storded as a java.lang.String in Java, but will be stored in the most appropriate format for other languages.
    • EHJava.{Fully qualifed Java class name}: In this case, the object is some other Java object which will be serialized as a iwork.eheap.WrappedObject and is only available to an application if the local JVM has access to the class.
    • [otherplatform].{fully qualified clas name}: In this case the object is from some other platform or language and appears as a iwork.eheap.WrappedObject in the Java version which is inaccessible.
    NOTE: All the constructors and set methods that take a Class object for the type automatically create a String version that matches one of the above types.
  • Name: The name of this field, for example, "EventType". This is a string.
  • Post Value: The value to use when posting the event.
  • Template Value: The value to use when using this event as a template to match against events in the Event Heap.
See 'FieldValue' for more information on the possibilities for the the two value sub-fields.

Constructor Detail

Field

public Field(java.lang.String name,
             FieldType type,
             FieldValue postValue,
             FieldValue templateValue)
      throws EventHeapException
Creates a new field with the given name, type, post and template values.

Parameters:
name - name for the new field.
type - FieldType object representing type for this field.
postValue - FieldValue object that will be the post value of this field. If the FieldValue is not virtual or formal, the type of its actual value must be the same as the type of this field.
templateValue - FieldValue object that will be the template value of this field. If the FieldValue is not virtual or formal, the type of its actual value must be the same as the type of this field.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if type doesn't agree with the type of the postValue or templateValue objects. An exception is also thrown if any of the arguments are null.

Field

public Field(java.io.DataInputStream dis)
      throws EventHeapException
Reads the data for a field out of the given input stream and creates a new field identical to the one represented in the stream. The field needs to have been placed into the stream by the writeField() method.

Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if the new field is unable to be created from the data read from the input stream. This may happen if the data read doesn't represent a field, if the data is corrupt, or if the stream prematurely runs out of bytes (for example if a socket connection is dropped).
Method Detail

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Gets the name of this field

Returns:
the name of this field

getType

public FieldType getType()
                  throws EventHeapException
Get the type of this field in string form.

Returns:
the type of this field as a fully qualified class name.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was a problem deserializing the cached field data.

setPostValue

public void setPostValue(FieldValue value)
                  throws EventHeapException
Set the value of this field. The value is set by reference, so future changes to the passed in object will effect the field value.

Parameters:
value - A FieldValue object which indicates the post value of this field.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if 'value' has a different type than this field.

setPostValueString

public void setPostValueString(java.lang.String valueString)
                        throws EventHeapException
Sets the post value sub-field of the field from valueString. If the string is one of the values in FieldValueTypes.typeArray, it will be set to the corresponding field value type (if the type is ACTUAL, the field value will be set to null). If valueString is not in FieldValueTypes.typeArray, the library will attempt to parse the string based on the type of the field. For the standard field types (int, long, float, double, string) it will parse it into a numeric value (for the former four types) or just use the valueString directly (for the "string" type). If the field type is not one of the four standard types an exception is thrown.

Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was a problem accessing the field, usually because it was corrupted in transmission, or if the valueString couldn't be parsed into a valid value for the field.

getPostValue

public FieldValue getPostValue()
                        throws EventHeapException
Get the post value of this field.

Returns:
The post value of the field
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was a problem deserializing the cached field data.

setTemplateValue

public void setTemplateValue(FieldValue value)
                      throws EventHeapException
Set the value of this field. The value is set by reference, so future changes to the passed in object will effect the field value.

Parameters:
value - A FieldValue object which indicates the template value of this field.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if 'value' has a different type than this field.

setTemplateValueString

public void setTemplateValueString(java.lang.String valueString)
                            throws EventHeapException
Sets the template value sub-field of the field from valueString. If valueString is not in FieldValueTypes.typeArray, the library will attempt to parse the string based on the type of the field. For the standard field types (int, long, float, double, string) it will parse it into a numeric value (for the former four types) or just use the valueString directly (for the "string" type). If the field type is not one of the four standard types an exception is thrown.

Throws:

writeField

public void writeField(java.io.DataOutputStream dos)
                throws EventHeapException
Writes the data for a field to the given output stream. The field can be read back from some input stream to create a field identical to this one using the Field(DataInputStream) constructor.

Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there is a problem writing to the outputStream, for example if it is closed or dropped while data is being written.

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
If obj is also a Field, returns true if all of the sub-fields in this Field are identical to the sub-fields of the other Field. Otherwise returns false. For now this means that Fields containing wrapped objects are never equal unless they are the same wrapped object instance (the default Object equals behavior).

hashCode

public int hashCode()
Returns a hashcode for this Field object. The hashcode is the sum of the hashcodes for all the sub-fields.

matches

public boolean matches(Field matchField)
Returns true if the two fields match. For two fields to match, either the field on which this method being invoked has a 'VIRTUAL' template FieldValueType or the following things must be true:
  • matchField!=null
  • matchFIeld.getPostValue().getFieldValueType!=VIRTUAL
  • this.fieldName==matchField.fieldName
  • this.fieldType==matchField.fieldType
  • this.fieldTemplateValue.matches(matchField.fieldPostValue)
Field matching is not transitive since the values used by the Field on which match() was invoked are taken from the template value, and the values used in the field being matched are taken from the post value.

NOTE: Since virtual implies that a field is to be ignored in matching events, in general, match should not be invoked on a field with a virtual template value, nor should a field with a virtual post value be passed to the method. Doing so when using Field.match() in matching events may cause event matching semantics to be violated.

Parameters:
matchField - the field to be matched against.
Returns:
'true' if fields match, 'false' if they do not.
